Best Ultra-Luxury Car: Bentley Arnage.

Interesting, isn't it, that the old- school car, the veddy much more mature Bentley Arnage, topped out the category in a three-way shootout between the Maybach and the new Rolls-Royce Phantom. So what does this say about ultra-luxury buyers?

This is a new category to the America's Best survey primarily because this is a renewed category to America. Maybe these carmakers know something about the economic warp and woof that we don't, but introducing not one but three (two Maybachs plus the BMW-designed Rolls) all-new $300,000-plus luxury sedans to the world seems over-the-top- especially in this economic environment. Regardless, it is something to see that the AutoWeek enthusiast didn't succumb to the glamorous and glitzy, but opted with a tried-and-true blue blood. Could it be a rub-off thanks to the Bentley's recent Le Mans win? Could it be that discriminating tastes like traditional design when it comes to their house-on-wheels choice? We can't answer that, but we do know this segment will not evaporate, and with the advent of a new Bentley sedan on the horizon it will be an even more interesting vote in the future.

AutoWeek
July 7, 2003
